sub_title: Technical Author and Editor/Scientific Content Expert/General Communications/Analytics/Process and Project Management/Making the complex simple.
summary: I have 15 years of experience at ESA mainly in analysing scientific and technological results related to human spaceflight research and translating these results into communication products for influencing decision makers and scientists etc. as to the value of ESA-funded research.

treasury_media.title: Research and Results from Columbus and the ISS.pdf
treasury_media.description: An overview of research and results from Columbus and the ISS following four years on orbit

treasury_media.title: Benefits_for_Humanity_3rd_Ed.pdf
treasury_media.description: The 3rd edition of the International Space Station Benefits for Humanity is a compilation of benefits being realized from International Space Station (ISS) activities in the areas of human health, Earth observations and disaster response, innovative technology, global education, and economic development of space. Personal contributions to the publication: pp 87, 91-92, 93-94, 95-97, 113-114, 116, 128, 130-132, 133--135, 137-138, 140-142, 148, 150, 159-160, 173-4, 183-184, 187

treasury_media.title: ESAReport_41stCOSPAR.pdf
treasury_media.description:
ESA SP-1333 ESA's Report to the 41th COSPAR meeting (21/07/2016) 

Human Spaceflight research activities (pp-85-143)

ESA is pushing the boundaries in all areas of science. This report covers ESA’s scientific activities over the two years since the last COSPAR assembly in 2014. It addresses the contributions of ESA’s Science and Robotic Exploration, Earth Observation and Human Spaceflight missions to international space science, giving updates on mission statuses and examples of science results.

treasury_media.title: ESA Bulletin 172.pdf
treasury_media.description:
ESA Bulletin 172. Astrobiology Special (4th quarter 2017)

This issue is all about ‘life’, the subject of astrobiology: the study of the origin, evolution, distribution and future of life in the Universe. Astrobiology improves our fundamental knowledge about our own existence, addressing primarily scientific and philosophical questions, as well as helping our preparations for future missions – robotic exploration and human exploration – and enhancing our activities in planetary protection.

treasury_media.title: Laboratory Science with Space Data
treasury_media.description: The chapter on Space and Ground-Based Infrastructure deals with the main characteristics of the space environment, outside and inside a spacecraft followed by a description of on-orbit infrastructure. Hereafter a variety of space and space-related infrastructure is described including the International Space Station, which holds many European facilities.

treasury_media.description: SPACE FOR LIFE human spaceflight science newsletter Issue 8 | July 2015

authors.headline: Technical Author and Editor/Scientific Content Expert/General Communications/Analytics/Process and Project Management/Making the complex simple.

profile_positions.description:
My principal focus has been in the creation of communications materials on scientific research, focussed on different areas of human physiology, biology and the physical sciences. Products aimed at different audiences incl. decision makers and scientists. This includes:

- TRACKING/COLLECTING/ANALYSING RESULTS ARTICLES OF AGENCY-SUPPORTED RESEARCH.
More than 1000 peer-reviewed/conference articles uncovered in first year of tracking. Involved extensive networking with science teams and key personnel.

- IN DEPTH KNOWLEDGE IN DIFFERENT RESEARCH AREAS 
     - Neuroscience, immune system, cardiopulmonary, musculoskeletal
     - Astrobiology, plant biology, cell biology, developmental biology
     - Materials and  fluids research, soft matter
     - Solar/Radiation research
     - Relativity/quantum mechanics 

- CONCEIVING/DEFINING COMMUNICATIONS PRODUCTS
Selecting optimal format and source information. Selecting relevant results as principal focus taking into account scientific importance and research platform.

- COPYWRITING AND GRAPHICS
Translating research articles/source material into fit-for-purpose communications content/products aimed at associated target group, incl. required editorial and graphics work.

- COORDINATING/FOLLOWING REQUIRED PUBLICATION PROTOCOLS
Full understanding of required approval and confidentiality processes. Coordination of end-to-end production/approval processes for products often involving ad hoc projects and very tight deadlines.

- EXTENSIVE PRODUCT PORTFOLIO IN DIFFERENT FORMATS
Factsheets and Brochures, Newsletters, Conference articles and reports, Web Content, Book chapters, high level Internal reports (for decision makers up to ESA Council level), Presentations, Film scripts.

- STRATEGY AND ANALYTICS (Incl NON-ESA MODIS PROJECTS)
Led a team to define communication strategy. Developed more results-based communications content. Provided strategic inputs to proposals. ESA/NASA comparative analytics. Strategic website analytics.
profile_positions.title: Scientific Content Expert

profile_positions.description:
My main responsibility was the creation of communications products and content based on the performance of European missions and research on the International Space Station (ISS) and associated research platforms. Target audiences included students and general public. This included:

- COPYWRITING AND GRAPHICS
Translating source material into easy-to-digest communications products for different target groups including associated graphics work.

- DEFINING COMMUNICATIONS PRODUCTS
Selecting optimal product format and relevant source information (graphic and text).

- EXTENSIVE PRODUCT PORTFOLIO IN DIFFERENT FORMATS
Press kits, regular press releases and web articles, factsheets, brochures, newspapers, European inputs to NASA press kits.

- COORDINATING/FOLLOWING REQUIRED PUBLICATION PROTOCOLS
Full understanding of required approval processes. Coordination of end-to-end approval process for specific products often involving ad hoc projects and very tight deadlines.
profile_positions.title: Content Coordinator

profile_positions.description: Responsible for all text-based content used within company products and communications for a developer of online management training simulations. This included overseeing production of corporate brochures concerning the company and its products; writing learning objectives and instructions on using the company software; and writing content for use in the company’s products to create a ‘realistic’ learning environment for participants. The role also involved testing and debugging of company products.
profile_positions.title: Public Relations Officer/Senior Copywriter

profile_positions.description: Freelance business analyst, carrying out short- and long-term contracts for different organisations including the British Royal Navy, TPF&C, Gillette UK and Rank Xerox in different locations in England. This involved work as financial and systems analyst as well as systems supervisor for various systems.
profile_positions.title: Contract Work

profile_positions.description: Various roles/contracts including a one-to-one sign language teaching expert for deaf child with spina bifida, a sign language support and mathematics teacher in a deaf school, and a drama teacher running private after school clubs for classes of 15-20 students involving creating lesson content and writing/coordinating plays and performances.
profile_positions.title: Teacher
